data.title: I love the homemade food at the Picnic sandwich shop!
data.text:
I ate at the picnic shop and we met in their back room!
I had a great salad, and they fixed a pie for all the people who sold tickets to our lawn free garden tour!

data.title: You'll Be Transported
data.text:
This restaurant smells like my husband's grandparents' old home in Stockton.
  That's not an insult.
  Every time we visit, I do not feel like I am in living in the 21st century.
  The tables, chairs, foods, carpeting, family photos...everything makes you think of a bygone time, when families worked together to build businesses [ as this restaurant can boast] and foods were not outlandish, foods you could make in your own kitchen, if you wanted to.
   THE PIE IS INCREDIBLE! Don't leave without having at least one slice!

data.title: it nice place to eat
data.text: great pies, good sandwich way you want them to make them kind of mom and pop subway but the sandwich and soup and food better taste though

data.title: Local favorite!
data.text: Te Picnic Sandwich shop is a local favorite for lunch.  The sandwiches are fresh, made in front of you, salad bar is also fresh but sometimes a little sparse, but the homemade pies are to die for.  This restaurant is the place we order our holiday pies from for parties and dinners....each and every flavor (and I've probably tried them all) are truly lovely.  Go for the lunch but stay and visit over coffee and pie!

data.title: Always tasty.
data.text: Whatever you are hungry for, you will find a great answer at Picnic Sandwich Shop. Lots of choices and flavors to please.

data.title: An old Visalia standby
data.text: Reasonable, clean and good food. Looks like a cafeteria set up, but home made pies and salads, hand made sandwiches to order with their own prepared meats.

data.title: Tasty Sandwiches, Old School Vibe
data.text:
Staff was really nice and the sandwiches are delicious. My BLTA with turkey added was awesome. The bacon is real and it's crispy - not some limp pre-cooked bacon shipped in.

The decor has a cool retro vibe that is awesome. Old photos mixed with new and the big menu above where they make your sandwich to order still has an original look - love it. 

They have pies and other side dishes too.

Next time. I come thru here on my way to sequoia, I am stopping in.
Forget subway (which is just a block away) and come here!

data.title: quick bite
data.text: googled this nearby place. it is in their heart of old downtown Visalia, ca. when you enter the building the ceilings are tall and the decoration is family like with lots of throwback decoration, old 60-70s lighting, very nastalgic but immaculate and smelled fresh, its an addition to the bakery located next door. the food was great, I had a Reuben with corned beef, my buddy had the roast beef. both were excellent served with homemade pasta salad. the service was excellent. like I said clean,fresh, great sandwiches, great service..

data.title: Bonitinho
data.text:
Lugar charmoso com um ambiente bastante familiar. 

Estavam montando o buffet de almoço quando chegamos. A comida parecia ser bem gostosa.

O cafe que tomei e o lanche que meu marido pediu, estavam ok.
